title: Sinner Defeats Alcaraz to Win ATP Finals, Defends Title in Turin
snippets: Jannik Sinner beat Carlos Alcaraz for just the second time this year and defended his ATP Finals crown in Turin.

Jannik Sinner retained the ATP Finals title in Turin as he beat Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets. The Alcaraz and Sinner rivalry is too hot for the rest of the field.
Jannik Sinner saw off close rival Carlos Alcaraz to clinch the ATP Finals title with a 7-6 (7-4) 7-5 victory after the Spaniard struggled with a hamstring injury.

The final installment of the “Sincaraz” rivalry for 2025 went to Jannik Sinner. The second-ranked Sinner beat the top-ranked Carlos Alcaraz 7-6 (4), 7-5 for the ATP Finals trophy on Sunday in the sixth meeting this year between the two players who are dominating men’s tennis.

Malgré un match accroché, le numéro un mondial n’a pas réussi, dimanche, à renverser son dauphin transalpin. Celui-ci s’est imposé 7-6, 7-5 et reste invaincu dans le « tournoi des maîtres » depuis la finale de l’édition 2023.
